case_vignette: A 66-year-old female with past medi   cal history of right breast cancer treated with radiation presents with a slowly growing mass on the right breast. She state   s the spo   t initially began as a small bruise t hen progressively    enlargened over the past few months and  now spontaneously bleeds. Examination reveals a violaceous, red exophytic thick nodule on    the right breast. An excisional biopsy reveal s atypical pleomorphic endothelial cells lining ill-defined vascular spaces and prominent hemorrhage.

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Dermatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I have a slowly growing mass on my right breast that started as a small bruise, has gotten bigger over the past few months, and now it's bleeding on its own.
Is there any pain associated with the mass?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing any pain with the mass.
Have you experienced any changes in your skin or nipple, such as skin puckering or an inverted nipple?
No, I haven't mentioned experiencing any changes in the skin or nipple like skin puckering or an inverted nipple.
Do you have any family history of breast cancer or any other cancers?
I have not mentioned any family history of breast cancer or any other cancers.
Have you noticed any swollen lymph nodes in your armpit or around your collarbone?
No, I haven't mentioned noticing any swollen lymph nodes in my armpit or around my collarbone.
Have you had any previous breast biopsies or surgeries on your breasts?
Yes, I have a history of right breast cancer for which I was treated with radiation.
Final Diagnosis: Angiosarcoma of the breast
